contents:
Malaria, a disease carried by Anopheles mosquitoes, kills over 1.5 million people in Africa every year. According to World Bank reports, mosquito-borne diseases are the leading killer of African children. Epidemic malaria in the highlands of eastern Africa is closely associated with climatic hazards such as the El Niño phenomenon.

ISCU Regional Office for Africa Science Plan, Natural and Human Induced Hazards and Disasters in sub-Saharan Africa. [http://www.icsu-africa.org/docs/DocSP03.1.pdf].
